means: （指狗）吠，嗥叫， （人）咆哮( snarl的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: He raced ahead up into the bush, barking and snarling.
sentence.Network_cn: 它嗥叫着冲向前，一头钻进了灌木丛。

sentence.Network_en: I vaguely remember snarling at someone who stepped on my foot.
sentence.Network_cn: 我隐约记得我曾向着那个踩了我一脚的人怒吼。

sentence.Network_en: " I didn't marry you, " he said, in a snarling tone.
sentence.Network_cn: “ 我没有娶你, " 他咆哮着说.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 2007年11月24日 - we.i.nan的日志 - 网易博客 ... ) profound 意义深远的 ) snarling 纠缠的 ) void 空虚，惆怅.
英语广播词汇（3）|无忧教育 ... smail n. 蜗牛 snarling adj. 咆哮的 sneaky adj. 偷偷摸摸地，鬼鬼祟祟的.

resembling a cur ; snarling and rude ., 类似于恶狗 ; 难缠而且粗鲁.

list.abs: the accident snarled up traffic for hours ., 事故使交通堵塞数小时.
traffic snarls of a big city ., 大城市的交通混乱.
widening the existing roads can solve traffic snarls on some level .拓宽现有道路，可以一定程度上解决交通挤塞。
make a snarling noise or move with a snarling noise ., 发出吼叫的声音或者带着吼叫的声音移动.
4. snarlssnarling test 打结试验snatch 抢

entry.def: When an animal snarls, it makes a fierce, rough sound in its throat while showing its teeth.

example.ex: He raced ahead up into the bush, barking and snarling...
example.tran: 它嗥叫着冲向前，一头钻进了灌木丛。

example.ex: The dogs snarled at the intruders.
example.tran: 那些狗冲着闯入者狂吠不已。

entry.tran: 厉声说;吼叫着说;怒气冲冲地说
entry.def: If you snarl something, you say it in a fierce, angry way.

example.tran: 他气急败坏地喊道：“放开我。”

example.ex: I vaguely remember snarling at someone who stepped on my foot...
example.tran: 我隐约记得我曾向着那个踩了我一脚的人怒吼。

entry.def: A snarl is a disorganized mass of things.

example.ex: She was tangled in a snarl of logs and branches.
example.tran: 她被困在一堆乱七八糟的木料和树枝中间。

example.ex: A radio-link automatically advises it of traffic snarls and plots a detour.
example.tran: 一个无线电接入装置会自动通知交通拥堵状况，并给出绕行建议。
